description: The COVID-19 death toll continues to rise in China's economic hub of Shanghai even as strict lockdown measures wreak havoc in the daily lives of ordinary people.

title: Covid-19 'R-Value' for Delhi Crosses 2 This Week; What Does it Mean for India, Its Implication | Explained
description: The 'R' or reproductive value indicates the number of people an infected person can pass on the disease to
content:
In a first, the R-value for the Covid-19 virus in Delhi which is an indicator of how quickly the infection is spreading, crossed over 2 thereby raising an alarm across the medical fraternity and researchers in India.

title: 55 COVID positive cases found in IIT Madras; TN health secretary claims situation 'under control'

title: Foot traffic picks up in Western Canada’s downtown areas as COVID-19 restrictions lift
description: Business groups in Vancouver, Edmonton and Calgary hope that, along with the office workers, everyone who once went downtown for shopping, entertainment and restaurants will be lured back to the rejuvenated city centres

title: Mandate COVID Vaccination for Adults, Don’t Make School-going Children a Scapegoat
description: Covid-19 and children: Hardly have the waters settled and mandatory masking revoked, we are faced with the spectre of increasing cases of Covid-19 being reported from certain parts of the country. Parents find themselves facing another Catch-22 situation – to school or not to school?

title: Malaysia reports 6,342 new COVID-19 infections, 12 new deaths
description: Malaysia reported 6,342 new COVID-19 infections as of midnight Friday, bringing the national total to 4,421,443, according to the health ministry.
content: Kuala Lumpur [Malaysia], April 23 (ANI/Xinhua): Malaysia reported 6,342 new COVID-19 infections as of midnight Friday, bringing the national total to 4,421,443, according to the health ministry. There are 20 new imported cases, with 6,322 being local... [680 chars]

title: Pakistan logs 82 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
description: Pakistan reported 82 new COVID-19 cases and one death from the pandemic during the past 24 hours, said the country's health ministry on Saturday.
